title: Use accumulation for change in temperature of tea

content.question: A cup of tea is cooling in a room that has a constant temperature of 70 degrees Fahrenheit <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mo>°</mo> <mtext>F</mtext> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D78@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. If the initial temperature of the tea, at time <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG0bGaeyypa0JaaGimaaaa@3BB4@</annotation> </semantics> </math> minutes, is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>200</mn> <mo>°</mo> <mtext>F</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E00@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and the temperature of the tea changes at the rate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>R</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mo>−</mo> <mn>6.89</mn> <msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>0.053</mn> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@483B@</annotation> </semantics> </math> degrees Fahrenheit per minute, what is the temperature, to the nearest degree, of the tea after 4 minutes?

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Use appropriate units of measure.
